properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 8:55PM PST until February 2 at 3:27AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

South Fork Nooksack River At Saxon Bridge affecting Whatcom County
Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County
Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County


The second push of heavy rain is coming in now and with the 4 to 5
inches previously, the Noocksack and Stillaguamish River will rise
past flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The South Fork Nooksack River At Saxon Bridge
* from late tonight to late Saturday night.
* At  8:00 PM Friday the stage was 6.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 2 AM
Saturday and crest near 9.2 feet around 10 AM Saturday. The river
will fall below flood stage Saturday evening.
* Impact...At 8.5 feet, the Nooksack River flooding will be widespread
with swift water covering farm lands and many roads.  Highway 9
north of Acme may be impassable.  Erosion may affect some river
banks.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
